title: Macron calls snap elections after historic far-right gains in European vote
summary: The Rassemblement National, led by Marine Le Pen's lieutenant Jordan Bardella, dominated the election in France, winning 31.5% of the votes, according to initial estimates. President Emmanuel Macron called snap elections that will be held on June 30 and July 7.

title: 2024 European elections: Far-right Rassemblement National achieves historic success
summary: The party led by Marine Le Pen's lieutenant Jordan Bardella was credited with over 30% of the vote, according to initial estimates on Sunday.

title: 2024 European elections results: Explore our map and view the make-up of the future Parliament
summary: Our map representing the 720 seats in the European Parliament will update as estimates and results come in.

title: EU election results: The main takeaways
summary: More than 360 million people were eligible to vote in 27 countries. The far-right finished first in France, Italy and Austria and came second in Germany and the Netherlands, according to preliminary results.

title: Watch: Macron calls snap elections after Bardella claims victory
summary: After the far-right Rassemblement National's dominant score in the European elections, its candidate Jordan Bardella called for President Emmanuel Macron to hold early elections. Unexpectedly, Macron did just that.

title: European elections 2024: Socialist Raphaël Glucksmann wins his gamble, coming in third place
summary: The left-wing list is estimated to have won 14% of the vote according to the Ipsos institute for France Télévisions, Radio France, France 24/RFI and Public Sénat/LCP Assemblée Nationale. It trails the presidential majority.

title: Israel war cabinet minister Gantz quits government
summary: 'Netanyahu is preventing us from progressing to a real victory,' Gantz said in a televised address, whose party has submitted a bill to dissolve the parliament.

title: Carlos Alcaraz, crown prince of Roland-Garros
summary: After winning at the US Open and Wimbledon, the 21-year-old Spaniard toppled Alexander Zverev (6-3, 2-6, 5-7, 6-1, 6-2) on the French Open clay court on Sunday, taking over the title from his idol and compatriot Rafael Nadal.

title: Putin, Netanyahu and the instrumentalization of the Second World War
summary: The Russian president and Israeli prime minister are manipulating the history of WWII in order to equate their enemies in both Ukraine and Palestine with the Nazis.

title: Rising danger on the border between Lebanon and Israel
summary: Hezbollah has intensified the frequency and scale of its attacks on northern Israel, while Israel has threatened a military operation.

title: Europeans are worried about Trump's return to the White House
summary: Whoever the president may be, it won't make much of a difference on the economic front. In terms of security, however, the EU 27 are concerned about Trump's criticism of NATO and the US's growing disinterest in the EU.

title: Assault that left Danish PM 'shaken' likely not 'politically motivated'
summary: A 39-year-old Polish man, apprehended after hitting Mette Frederiksen on Friday evening on a Copenhagen square, was remanded in custody until June 20.

title: Protectionist escalation: 'Europe could be engulfed in the economic rivalry between China and the US'
summary: New US tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles mark a turning point in the fragmentation of trade, says economist Agathe Demarais in an interview with Le Monde.

title: WWII veteran, 100, marries sweetheart, 96, in Normandy after D-Day events
summary: Harold Terens and his sweetheart Jeanne Swerlin said 'I do' in the Normandy town of Carentan-les-Marais at a ceremony attended by dozens of guests.

title: Christophe Deloire, secretary general of Reporters Without Borders, has died
summary: The face of the press freedom NGO passed away on Saturday at the age of 53 'as a result of fast-spreading cancer,' the organization announced.

title: Meloni has won over Biden, now she hopes for Trump's return
summary: The Italian prime minister cultivates a long-standing closeness with American conservative circles, and hopes to capitalize on this politically if the former Republican president returns to the White House.

title: Aid being delivered to Gaza from US pier once again
summary: The pier has been plagued by problems since its inception. It broke apart due to high winds and strong waves last month.

title: What are the five best traditional baguettes in the Paris region?
summary: These addresses follow the traditional French baguette recipe to a T. With honeycombed crumb, crisp crust and a subtle, sourdough taste, it's a treat from morning to night.

title: 2024 European elections: EU Parliament slides to the right
summary: The nationalist and sovereignist parties of the right wing are set to take up more than a quarter of the Parliament, and conservatives are making headway. On the left, while Social Democrats managed to hold out, the Greens' support collapsed, particularly in France and Germany.

title: Russian interference: European media caught in a bind
summary: The Kremlin takes advantage of media coverage of its disinformation efforts in Europe to further strengthen them.

title: Dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale: Macron's gamble after EU election setback
summary: The French president surprised his allies, including the prime minister, by announcing new legislative elections on June 30 and July 7. An all-or-nothing bet that could result in propelling the far-right to Matignon.

title: European elections: Despite poor results, the Greens hope to influence the EU agenda
summary: The Greens, who are in sharp decline in France and Germany and have lost their grip on the Green Deal, could have a card to play if Commission President Ursula von der Leyen is reappointed.

title: Israel: Netanyahu and his extremist allies alone  in power after Benny Gantz leaves government
summary: The centrist has left the unity government, which he considers to be deadlocked in Gaza, and is calling for early elections.

title: European election results: A more conservative Parliament under pressure from far right
summary: The mainstream conservative parties are set to come under pressure from the far-right in Parliament after the European elections saw their record gains, particularly in France and Germany, and the collapse of the Greens.

title: France's snap election: Surprised far right sets its sights on majority
summary: Emmanuel Macron's announcement of snap legislative elections took far-right leaders by surprise after their historic gains in the European Parliament on Sunday.

title: France's snap elections: Three weeks to avoid the worst
summary: Emmanuel Macron is faced with the contradictory challenge he set himself: To reduce the far-right vote without having implemented a policy capable of eradicating its roots. On June 30 and July 7, nothing less than the future of our democracy will be decided, in a hurry.

title: Why Macron decided to call snap elections
summary: A small group of close confidants quietly worked on the high-risk scenario. Allies of former president Nicolas Sarkozy pushed President Macron to take the plunge. Sunday's catastrophic score in the European elections precipitated the decision.

title: India experiences longest heatwave in country's history
summary: Parts of northern India have been gripped by a heatwave since mid-May. India's Meterological Department chief has cautioned that the worse is yet to come.

title: Paris stock market falls post EU elections results
summary: Markets throughout Europe sank along with the euro on Monday after a win for far-right parties in EU elections.

title: Bardella to be far-right candidate for French prime minister
summary: The Rassemblement National's 28-year-old leader was nominated after President Emmanuel Macron announced snap parliamentary elections following the far right's historic lead in Sunday's EU elections.

title: After Glucksmann's strong score in European elections, Socialists are divided over next steps
summary: The Socialist-backed candidate was not far behind the presidential camp, with 13.8%. But the question of a left-wing alliance after Emmanuel Macron's shock snap election announcement is already threatening to tear the PS apart.
